grid.initial_pop_size: Number of people initially spawned in grid
grid.number_iterations: Number of total iterations of simulation

render.fps: How fast in frames-per-second to run the simulation ('None' for as-fast-as-possible)

person.age_range: The range for selecting someone's age
person.movement_prob: Defines the probability of a person moving each iteration
person.altruistic_movement_prob: The movement probability of someone who is altruistic (defined below)
person.move_length: Number of steps a person can take if they decide to move
person.initial_infection_prob: The probability of infection when initially spawning people
person.altruistic_prob: Probability of being altruistic and therefore social distancing and wearing a mask when symptoms arise
person.policy_type: Picks one of the predefined policies in 'main.py' which defines initial spawn probabilities for social distancing, wearing a mask and not moving around too much

disease.base_infection_prob: The base infection probability of one infectious person
disease.mask_infection_prob_decrease: The decrease in 'base_infection_prob' if the infectious person is wearing a mask
disease.total_length_infection: Total length in days (usually) of the infection in a person (REF 3)
disease.incubation_period_duration_range: Range of possible number of incubation days (REF 3)
disease.infectious_period_duration_range: Range of possible number of infectious days (REF 3)
disease.infectious_start_before_symptoms_range: Range of possible number of days the infectious stage starts before symptoms start (REF 3)
disease.severity_prob: The probability of severe symptoms (given not asymptomatic) (REF 8)
disease.severe_symptoms_start_range: The range of possible number of days that severe symptoms begin after mild symptoms starting
disease.death_prob: The probability of death occurring (given severe symptoms, hence why its high-ish) (REF 8)
disease.death_occurrence_range: The range of possible number of days that death occurs after severe symptoms begin
disease.asymptomatic_prob: The probability of being asymptomatic (no symptoms but still infectious) (REF 1)
